content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 5 is:

1->2->3->4

Note that the path may contain more than one edge in the graph. The shortest path is the path that uses the fewest edges. If you want to know the shortest path using a different starting or destination node, please provide more information.

The shortest path from node 5 to node 2 is:

6->3

Note that the path may contain more than one edge in the graph. The shortest path is the path that uses the fewest edges. If you want to know the shortest path using a different start or destination node, please provide more information.
